meanings.sent1: The doctor diagnosed her malady as a common cold.
meanings.sent2: The malady spread quickly through the village.
meanings.sent3: Despite his malady, he still managed to make everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The malady of loneliness crept into her heart.
meanings.sent5: The malady of forgetfulness plagued him daily.

meanings.definition: A condition of poor health or illness.
meanings.sent1: Her persistent malady made it hard for her to work.
meanings.sent2: The malady of poverty affected many families in the area.
meanings.sent3: His malady seemed to disappear whenever he heard music.
meanings.sent4: The malady of despair weighed heavily on her shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The malady of exhaustion left him drained and weary.
